```suggestion
  refine âŸ¨b 0, fun n â†¦ ?_âŸ©
  simpa only [dist_partial_sum'] using key n (n + 1) 0 (zero_le _) (zero_le _)
```

```suggestion
  have hw := (norm_nonneg z).trans_lt hz -- `0 < â€–wâ€–`
```

```suggestion
  refine cauchySeq_finset_of_geometric_bound (r := â€–zâ€– / â€–wâ€–) (C := C) ((div_lt_one hw).mpr hz)
    (fun n â†¦ ?_)
  rw [norm_mul, norm_pow, div_pow, â† mul_comm_div]
  conv at hC => enter [n]; rw [norm_mul, norm_pow, â† _root_.le_div_iff (by positivity)]
  exact mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right (hC n) (pow_nonneg (norm_nonneg z) n)
```
Just a suggestion...

```suggestion
/-- If a power series converges at `w`, it converges absolutely at all `z` of smaller norm. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- If a power series converges at 1, it converges absolutely at all `z` of smaller norm. -/
```

Don't put in a comment what you can put in code:
```suggestion
  have hw : 0 < â€–wâ€– := (norm_nonneg z).trans_lt hz
```
I think this needs to be renamed a bit, `bounded` and `cauchy_series` aren't names so this seems very hard to discover using the naming convention at present
I don't know; `cauchy_series` is in two other theorems in this file. `exists_norm_le_of_cauchySeq`?
I think that those should also be changed, but let's not have that hold up this pr
